subject: RE: [junit] JUnit using Ant
msgSnippet: Why not use the JUnit task in Ant? Scott ... From: Thorsten Koller To: junit@yahoogroups.com Sent: 5/17/01 8:30 AM Subject: [junit] JUnit using Ant Hi! I m
messageBody:
Why not use the JUnit task in Ant?

Scott

-----Original Message-----
From: Thorsten Koller
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 5/17/01 8:30 AM
Subject: [junit] JUnit using Ant

Hi!
I'm using JUnit within the following ant-target:

<target name="runtests" depends="compiletests"
if="junit.present">
<java fork="yes" classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
taskname="junit" failonerror="false">
<arg value="AllTests"/>
<classpath>
<pathelement
location="${buildDestDir}/../${AppName}.jar"/>
<pathelement
location="${buildDestDir}/com/syntegra/de/net/auth/testcases"/>
<pathelement path="${ExtClassPath}" />
<pathelement path="${JunitPath}"/>
</classpath>
</java>
</target>

Trying to run my start class "AllTests" by typing "ant runtests", I get
the message:

"runtests:
[junit] Class "AllTests.class" not found
[junit] Java Result: -1"

The files are present in the directories as set in location attribute.

What does this mean.

Thanks in advance
-tk-
